programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: Follow the adventures of three elephants across three very distinct African habitats. Their travels combine to tell the story of how these emotional and intelligent creatures evolved over millions of years to survive on the continent.

programme.title: Baby Animals
programme.desc: Explore what it's like to grow up in a large animal group that offers protection from predators, lots of food, and social contact. Catch up with a newborn flamingo, three tiny reindeer, a baby African elephant, and a plains zebra born at a U.K. zoo.

programme.title: Land Of Primates
programme.desc: The gelada is a rare monkey that lives in the Simien Mountains of Ethiopia. They're charismatic, vocal, and mix affection and confrontation. Watch as they face the challenges of their habitat-and each other.

programme.title: Land Of Primates
programme.desc: It takes teamwork to survive in the De Hoop nature reserve. Watch as a group of Chacma baboons travel for food, deal with internal conflict, and try to earn each other's trust.

programme.title: Land Of Primates
programme.desc: As humans take up more space, the baboons of Africa must adapt. Travel across the continent to watch them form unbreakable social bonds, serve to protect their families and survive a changing landscape.

programme.title: Land Of Primates
programme.desc: Off the coast of Tanzania, baby Kima lives with his family of red colobus monkeys. But what happens when he loses his way? Discover how this little monkey learns to adapt to life in the jungle-and find out if he can reconnect with his family again.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: Spring on the east coast is a time of promise for two iconic island species: the New Zealand fur seal and the northern royal albatross. Both have returned to the land of their birth to breed.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand's isolated islands form an unusual paradise, home to a variety of incredible wildlife. Flightless birds, ancient reptiles, and coastal mammals take centre stage, but a closer look reveals another world.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: With more than 300 species, the snakes of Australia are as diverse and striking as the landscape they inhabit. Discover their clever hunting techniques, along with the ways their favourite prey, lizards, have evolved to outwit them.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: The southwest corner of New Zealand's South Island is hemmed in by giant mountains and the rough Pacific Ocean. Rare penguins are locked in a daily game of cat and mouse with giant New Zealand sea lions. The sea lions also live in a tumultuous world, where pups must battle the elements to survive.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: In southwestern New Zealand, deep fiords and tidal lagoons are wrapped in green rainforest. The dark fjords harbour creatures normally found in the deep. As winter approaches, bottlenose dolphins must escape their freezing fjord, while in a mountain river, a longfin eel heeds the call of the sea.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Descended from the Asian wolf, dingoes have been in Australia for over three thousand years. As apex predators, they keep feral animal numbers in check, but the introduction of non-native sheep and cattle has caused them problems.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Crocodiles are formidable predators, superbly adapted with skull-crushing jaws and lightning speed. They were on Earth long before the dinosaurs, and have outlived them by millions of years. Now protected in Australia, their numbers have surged.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: The Luangwa River is a lifeline for animals-and home to the world's largest concentration of hippos. See how these hippos spend their days dealing with heat, insects, and threats from their fellow river-dwellers.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Along the bank of the Luangwa River in Zambia lives a large troop of baboons. Despite the difficulties of the dry season, baby baboons are born. This is the story of a young male baboon who faces difficult choices as he comes of age.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand's isolated islands form an unusual paradise, home to a variety of incredible wildlife. Flightless birds, ancient reptiles, and coastal mammals take centre stage, but a closer look reveals another world.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: With more than 300 species, the snakes of Australia are as diverse and striking as the landscape they inhabit. Discover their clever hunting techniques, along with the ways their favourite prey, lizards, have evolved to outwit them.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: The southwest corner of New Zealand's South Island is hemmed in by giant mountains and the rough Pacific Ocean. Rare penguins are locked in a daily game of cat and mouse with giant New Zealand sea lions. The sea lions also live in a tumultuous world, where pups must battle the elements to survive.

programme.title: Shadowlands
programme.desc: In southwestern New Zealand, deep fiords and tidal lagoons are wrapped in green rainforest. The dark fjords harbour creatures normally found in the deep. As winter approaches, bottlenose dolphins must escape their freezing fjord, while in a mountain river, a longfin eel heeds the call of the sea.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Descended from the Asian wolf, dingoes have been in Australia for over three thousand years. As apex predators, they keep feral animal numbers in check, but the introduction of non-native sheep and cattle has caused them problems.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: Crocodiles are formidable predators, superbly adapted with skull-crushing jaws and lightning speed. They were on Earth long before the dinosaurs, and have outlived them by millions of years. Now protected in Australia, their numbers have surged.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: The Luangwa River is a lifeline for animals-and home to the world's largest concentration of hippos. See how these hippos spend their days dealing with heat, insects, and threats from their fellow river-dwellers.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Along the bank of the Luangwa River in Zambia lives a large troop of baboons. Despite the difficulties of the dry season, baby baboons are born. This is the story of a young male baboon who faces difficult choices as he comes of age.

programme.title: Tales From Zambia
programme.desc: Spend one day and one night in Zambia's Luangwa Valley with Africa's most fearsome hunters-a pride of lions. The lions are hungry because they haven't managed to make a large kill in days and tempers are starting to flare.

programme.title: Wildest New Zealand
programme.desc: New Zealand's isolated islands form an unusual paradise, home to a variety of incredible wildlife. Flightless birds, ancient reptiles, and coastal mammals take centre stage, but a closer look reveals another world.

programme.title: Nature Scenes
programme.desc: One half hour of a variety of butterflies set amindst a lush backdrop.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Non-native species have made their way into the Wild Wild East and staked their claim to the jagged coast. At White Point Beach Resort in Liverpool, Nova Scotia bunnies have hopped on in for an extended holiday. It's turf wars between the beachcombers and the chalets dwellers. Meanwhile, the starling population is beginning to rival gulls and pigeons.

programme.title: Wild Wild East
programme.desc: Wild Wild East travels through time and space to show what one-year - and four seasons - looks like for the wildest animals of Canada's East-Coast.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.desc: Amanda puts a radio collar on one of the first cheetah cubs born in Malawi in twenty years and the team struggles to give a 4-meter python a physical. See a group of tourists deliver a rambunctious baby monkey they rescued from the pet trade.

programme.title: Animal Empires
programme.desc: Around the world, farm animals such as pigs, donkeys, and chickens are known as livestock or pets. Few stories tell of their sister species who live in the wild. These animals must fend for themselves beyond the fences of their domesticated kin.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Africa's charismatic megafauna receive a lot of attention, but the antelope have rich stories filled with daily struggles of survival. Two antelope species, springbok and impala, outnumber all the others and play critical roles in the circle of life.

programme.title: Secrets Of Wild Australia
programme.desc: With more than 300 species, the snakes of Australia are as diverse and striking as the landscape they inhabit. Discover their clever hunting techniques, along with the ways their favourite prey, lizards, have evolved to outwit them.

programme.title: Into The Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Meet Blanco, a young capuchin, living in the rainforest. Blanco's home looks like paradise but he faces rival gangs and predators, including king vultures and jaguars, and must learn to find food. Can his family teach him before it's too late?

programme.title: Into The Wild Colombia
programme.desc: Emblamatic of Columbia's biodiversity, 150 species of hummingbirds can be found in its varied landscapes. Follow two mothers working to raise their young, a helmetcrest of the high altitude páramo, and an emerald hummingbird living in the rainforest.

programme.title: Into The Wild Colombia
programme.desc: From parched, earth-cracking drought to violent flooding, the Colombian Llanos is a land of extremes. Meet the fighters equipped to battle its shifting environment, the clever capybaras, burrowing owls, giant anteaters, and colonies of raucous birds.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Journey deep into the heart of a wild kingdom made of riverine forests and endless savanna. Here, a number of diverse keystone species are shaping the vibrant ecosystem, from dominant elephant herds to tiny dung beetles.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Explore a region that provides shelter to a wide array of life, despite its harsh conditions. Whether burrows of nocturnal bat-eared foxes or massive colonies of harvester ants, this ecosystem offers a wealth of resources to its native wildlife.

programme.title: Africa's Wild Horizons
programme.desc: Take a deep dive into a crater formed from the remains of a 2.5 million-year-old imploded volcano. See how the crater's plentiful land provides a home for key species, while its isolation also threatens their existence.
